item.title: Xcode - Change __MyCompanyName__
item.description: Does that even still work? Change __MyCompanyName__ Tired of seeing __MyCompanyName__ in all your files? To get your own reference in the header comments of all your Xcode files, you can set the default company name in Xcode with: defaults write com.apple.Xcode PBXCustomTemplateMacroDefinitions -di...

item.title: XBox 360
item.description: Obsolete Moved to XBox One a long time ago Restarting Internet Sharing Try something like this in a user daemon (use Lingon) sudo sh -c 'kill $(cat /var/run/bootpd.pid)' Make Internet Sharing DHCP work with an Xbox/Xbox 360 Network Many people have noticed that the Xbox and Xbox 360 will ...

item.title: The answer to the toughest interview question
item.description: There’s a lot of advice on this blog about how to interview: Tell good stories, ask good questions, be a closer.

item.title: Synology Container - Network Configuration
item.description: Source: www.wundertech.net/container-manager-on-a-synology-nas/ SSH then sudo -i then # Change 192.168.1.198 (Specific IP used here) and other network/gw/ip reference # Change name ph_network sudo docker network create -d macvlan -o parent=eth0 --subnet=192.168.1.0/24 --gateway=192.168.1.1 --ip-rang...

item.title: Secure VNC (MacOS X to MacOS X)
item.description: Obsolete Remote Mac Open System Preferences → Sharing → Apple Remote Desktop Start Open Access Privilege Set Access Privileges to allow “VNC viewers may control screen with password” Give it a password.

item.title: Secure Subversion
item.description: You should move to git Installing a secure SVN Source: www.sonzea.com/articles/subversion-trac.html Create a subversion repository If you don’t already have one, create a subversion repository: # cd /usr/local # svnadmin create repo Now create the basic structure and commit your changes to the repo...

item.title: Screen Capture - Leopard, other cats and Maverick
item.description: In 10.5, the region capture screenshot tool—that’s Shift-Command-4, which turns your cursor into a draggable crosshair—has learned quite a few new tricks.
